Package com.doa.engine.scene

Class DoaScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.doa.engine.scene.DoaScene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class DoaScene
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Responsible for keeping DoaObjects. A scene is composed of zero or more DoaObjects. DoaObjects can be added to a scene either by
    • invoking add(DoaObject) and passing an existing DoaObject
    • OR
    • creating a DoaObject with DoaObjectBuilder

    All DoaObjects inside a scene will have their DoaObject.tick() and DoaObject.render(DoaGraphicsContext) methods called by DoaEngine. If the scene the DoaObject is in is loaded using DoaSceneHandler.loadScene(DoaScene). This class is static, therefore has no objects.
    Since:
    DoaEngine 1.0
    Version:
    2.7
    Author:
    Doga Oruc
    See Also:

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(DoaObject o)
        Checks if the specified DoaObject from this scene. More formally, returns true if and only if this scene contains an element e such that Objects.equals(o, e).
        Parameters:
        o - object to remove from this scene
        Returns:
        true if this scene contains an element e such that Objects.equals(o, e)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes ALL of the DoaObjects from this scene. The scene will be empty after this method returns.
